ranked_differential_diagnosis.label: Bilateral Otosclerosis
ranked_differential_diagnosis.rationale_short: Longstanding history with previous right stapedotomy and persistent air-bone gap in the left ear.

ranked_differential_diagnosis.label: Sudden Sensorineural Hearing Loss (Right Ear)
ranked_differential_diagnosis.rationale_short: Acute onset of hearing loss in the right ear following a healed perforation, unresponsive to steroid treatment.

ranked_differential_diagnosis.label: Hyperacusis (Right Ear)
ranked_differential_diagnosis.rationale_short: Extreme sensitivity to sound in the right ear with LDLs at 10 dB SL, preventing standard testing.

ordered_list.rationale_short: To assess hearing thresholds following sudden loss and initial steroid treatment.
To evaluate word recognition and uncomfortable loudness levels.
Follow-up evaluation to monitor hearing status after second intratympanic injection.

expected_interpretations_by_visit.collective_interpretation: Evaluation revealed a complex bilateral mixed hearing loss. The left ear showed stable moderate-to-severe mixed loss with excellent word recognition. The right ear (post-stapedotomy) demonstrated severe mixed to sensorineural loss with extreme hyperacusis and unmeasurable word recognition.

tests.name: Pure-tone audiometry
tests.result_summary: Right ear: Severe mixed loss (250-2000 Hz) rising to moderate SNHL at 3000 Hz, sloping to severe SNHL (4000-6000 Hz). Left ear: Moderate-to-severe mixed loss. Masking limited by discomfort.

tests.name: Speech audiometry
tests.result_summary: Left ear: WRS 100% at 80 dB HL. Right ear: WRS DNT due to discomfort. Right LDL: 10 dB SL.

expected_interpretations_by_visit.collective_interpretation: Follow-up after the second steroid injection showed no improvement in the right ear, with a slight progression of loss in the high frequencies. The left ear remained stable.

tests.name: Pure-tone audiometry
tests.result_summary: Left ear stable. Right ear thresholds decreased by 10 dB HL at 500/3000 Hz and 25 dB HL at 6000/8000 Hz.

proposed_items: Demonstration of amplification options: Left monaural hearing aid, Left BiCROS, Left AOIS (on headband)
Fitting of Left Phonak Solana microP BTE BiCROS receiver with ITC transmitter
Fine-tuning adjustments (increased gain in mid/high frequencies for noise programs)
counseling_actions: Counseling on realistic expectations for BiCROS (localization, background noise)
Discussion of advantages and disadvantages of monaural vs. BiCROS vs. AOIS
Recommendation to wait on right ear amplification due to hyperacusis
Communication strategies (face-to-face, slow clear speech, distance < 3 feet, quiet environments)
Instruction on device use and care

escalation.rationale_short: Patient medically cleared for amplification after medical management of sudden loss was exhausted.

follow_up_plan.objective: Monitor progress with BiCROS, perform fine-tuning, and administer outcome questionnaire.

expected_outcome: Washington University School of Medicine Outcome Questionnaire: Improvement from 'Unaided' (U) to 'New' (N) reported across all domains (Home, Work, Social Situations).
Patient Report: Pleased with ability to hear music and people at a concert.
Patient Report: Doing well with BiCROS in quiet and on the telephone.
Patient Report: Slight improvement in background noise and significant improvement in quiet situations.
Patient Report: Noted some difficulty in background noise and hearing the TV, which was addressed with programming adjustments.
